entries.title: What happened with LockLogin?
content: Hello again!
For those who don't know, [LockLogin](https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/75156/) is a minecraft plugin
designed for servers which want to protect user accounts behind a password. The plugin included many
features such as 2fa authentication, brute force protection measures and many more. The problem is that
development for that project became harder and harder over the time as more features were introduced, for
that reason, LockLogin development stopped in order to release [LockLogin2](https://gitlab.com/karmadev/locklogin).
The problem is that, LockLogin2 is based on LockLogin, which means it would be also hard to maintain at
long-term, for which reason LockLogin project was completely abandoned, in favour of [AuthLock](https://gitlab.com/karmadev/authlock).
What is AuthLock?
AuthLock is, like LockLogin, an authentication minecraft plugin which is still in development, the main difference
between AuthLock and LockLogin, is that AuthLock is being made slowly, ensuring the code remains clean and as simple
as possible.
In conclusion; LockLogin project has been completely abandoned, in favour of AuthLock project, which release date is still
to be announced

entries.title: Hello world
content: Hello everyone! This is the first post entry in my portfolio. This portfolio has been
made using react and [Mantine](https://ui.mantine.dev/).
This portfolio was made as part of a school project, the project required me to make a portfolio
for which I've decided to make a portfolio which also serves as a landing page for all my projects.
During the development I've been facing some issues, for instance; the site automatically detects my age
based on my birthday date `06/08/2003`, for which I did a react component, which makes the calculations for
it. The content of the blog posts also use a custom react component, because the blog doesn't connect directly
to a database, I make all my posts on a json file, which the site reads. The content of the posts use a similar
syntax to markdown, which the react component is able to parse and map into Mantine components.
I know I've could just made a simple website, without using react nor "components", in fact, it was not a
requirement for the school project, but I decided to make it with react because this school project is planned to
be my public final portfolio. And if you are reading this, it means that it just happened.
Thanks for reading! ~Karma
